title: Dal Makhani

extendedIngredients.aisle: Pasta and Rice;Canned and Jarred;Ethnic Foods
extendedIngredients.name: lentils

summary: Dal Makhani takes roughly 1 hour and 20 minutes from beginning to end. This recipe serves 4. One portion of this dish contains roughly 8g of protein, 13g of fat, and a total of 238 calories. 1 person were glad they tried this recipe. Head to the store and pick up cumin seeds, chilli powder, chillies, and a few other things to make it today. It is brought to you by . If you like this recipe, take a look at these similar recipes: Arhar dal {Yellow split peas / Toovar dal} with spicy tempering, Paneer Makhani, and Pachai Payaru Kulambu (Green Moong Dal Curry).
instructions:
Pick, wash and soak whole black gram lentilsÂ and red kidney beansÂ overnight in three cups of water. Drain.
BoilÂ whole black gram lentilsÂ and red kidney beansÂ in three cups of water with salt andÂ half the red chilli powder for three whistles in pressure cooker. Add half the ginger.
Open the lid and see if the red kidney beans areÂ totally soft. If not cook on low heat till the red kidney beansÂ become totally soft.
Heat butter and oil in pan. Add cumin seeds. When they begin to change colour, add ginger, garlic and onion and sautÃ© until golden.
Add slit green chillies, tomatoes and sautÃ© on high heat. Add the remaining red chilli powder and sautÃ© till the tomatoes are reduced to a pulp.
Add the cooked dal andÂ red kidney beansÂ along with the cooking liquour. Add some water if the mixture is too thick. Add garam masala powder and adjust salt.
Simmer on low heat until the dals are totally soft and well blended. Serve hot.
